p: The GC analysis of the essential oils was carried. Citral, citronellal, and geraniol (from Sigma chemicals) were used as standards. Citral was found to be the major component in lemon grass, and was found to be present up to 81.84%. Geraniol is present at a concentration of 0.28%. In palm rosa oil 63.79% of geraniol and 3.72 % of citral was detected. In eucalyptus 76.8% of citronellal and 0.3% of geraniol was detected. In geranium oil 22.38% of geraniol and 2.47% of citronellal was detected. In citronella oil 29.2% of geraniol and 34.1% of citronellal was detected ( TableÂ 12).
